lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Sprinkel told a symposium sponsored by New York University that spending could be cut by avoiding decisions based on the desire to influence votes and by shifting the responsibility for local projects to state governments.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: "Our estimates at the Council of Economic Advisers suggest national net output of goods and services will permanently increase by approximately two pct because of the long-run consequences of tax reform," Sprinkel said.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: "Contrary to the conventional wisdom, therefore, the 1981 tax cut is not the root cause of the extraordinary budget deficits of the past few years," Sprinkel said.

lst.name: sentence
